questions.question: She worked ………………….. and passed the examination.
questions.description: Hard is the adverb for this meaning.

questions.question: We ………………….. see a lion.
questions.description: Rarely means seldom. Scarcely and hardly have different meanings.

questions.question: He often comes …………………… to school.
questions.description: Late is the opposite of early. Lately means recently.

questions.question: The journey was ………………….. uncomfortable.
questions.description: Fairly means reasonably or satisfactorily. It is not normally used with negative ideas.

questions.question: The lecture was …………………. boring
questions.description: Fairly is not normally used with negative ideas.

questions.question: Hardly ……………………. had any rest for weeks.
questions.description: When a negative word comes at the beginning of the sentence, we use the inverted word order.

questions.question: He is getting …………………….. day by day.
questions.description: We use the comparative form when an idea of progress is implied.

questions.question: He plays hockey very ……………………
questions.description: Good is an adjective well is an adverb.

questions.question: He is not ……………………. to go to school.
questions.description: When enough is an adverb, it goes after the adjective or adverb modified by it.
